page.title: 01LANDSCAPE RURAL
page.content: The area is towards the southern edge of the dip slope of the Berkshire Downs. To the north is a low chalk plateau in intensive cereal production without hedges as previously sheep grazing.To the south is a series of north_south spurs and valleys of low relief;the spurs capped by infertile Reading Beds and Plateau Gravels are wooded and managed for shooting rather than timber.The underlying London Clay with springs and heavy soils provides grazing for cattle and horses.The chalk valleys are in cereal production or vegetables for a farm shop (479727).Most of the land is owned by three families using modern methods and employing little labour. Planning control has retained the rural nature of the area only allowing new buildings in Winterbourne.
